snippet: The Twitter account run by Kenya's military was taken over by hackers claiming to be from the international activist collective Anonymous, a military spokesman said Monday
lead_paragraph: The Twitter account run by Kenya's military was taken over by hackers claiming to be from the international activist collective Anonymous, a military spokesman said Monday

headline.main: Kenya Military Twitter Account Hacked
headline.print_headline: Kenya Military Twitter Account Hacked

snippet: - Caleb Ndiku raced to gold and the first track medal at the Commonwealth Games as Kenya snatched a one-two in the men's 5,000m final on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: - Caleb Ndiku raced to gold and the first track medal at the Commonwealth Games as Kenya snatched a one-two in the men's 5,000m final on Sunday.

headline.main: Ndiku Leads Kenya One-Two in 5,000m Final
headline.print_headline: Ndiku Leads Kenya One-Two in 5,000m Final

snippet: A female tourist was shot dead in the coastal town of Mombasa, the second foreigner shot in same area this month, police officials said Thursday.
lead_paragraph: A female tourist was shot dead in the coastal town of Mombasa, the second foreigner shot in same area this month, police officials said Thursday.

headline.main: Gunmen Kill Female Tourist on Kenya Coast
headline.print_headline: Gunmen Kill Female Tourist on Kenya Coast

snippet: The Peace Corps is suspending its programs in Kenya because of security concerns and is pulling more than 50 volunteers out of the country until threat levels decrease, the Peace Corps and State Department said Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The Peace Corps is suspending its programs in Kenya because of security concerns and is pulling more than 50 volunteers out of the country until threat levels decrease, the Peace Corps and State Department said Thursday.

headline.main: US Pulls Peace Corps Volunteers From Kenya
headline.print_headline: US Pulls Peace Corps Volunteers From Kenya

snippet: Mathew Kisorio of Kenya made a winning return from a two-year doping ban in a 15-kilometer race in Bondo, Kenya.
lead_paragraph: Mathew Kisorio of Kenya made a winning return from a two-year doping ban in a 15-kilometer race in Bondo, Kenya.

headline.main: Kenyan Wins in Return From Doping Ban
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Wins in Return

snippet: An Oklahoma man has been charged with sexually abusing boys and girls while volunteering at an organization in Kenya that assists neglected children.
lead_paragraph: An Oklahoma man has been charged with sexually abusing boys and girls while volunteering at an organization in Kenya that assists neglected children.

headline.main: Man Charged in Oklahoma With Child Abuse in Kenya
headline.print_headline: Man Charged in Oklahoma With Child Abuse in Kenya

snippet: An Oklahoma teenager is charged with traveling to Kenya to sexually abuse children at a missionary children's home in the East African country, prosecutors said on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: An Oklahoma teenager is charged with traveling to Kenya to sexually abuse children at a missionary children's home in the East African country, prosecutors said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Oklahoma Teen Accused of Sexually Abusing Children in Kenya
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Teen Accused of Sexually Abusing Children in Kenya

snippet: Nine foreign nationals were charged in a Kenyan court on Thursday with trafficking the biggest ever single seizure of drugs at the Indian Ocean port of Mombasa.
lead_paragraph: Nine foreign nationals were charged in a Kenyan court on Thursday with trafficking the biggest ever single seizure of drugs at the Indian Ocean port of Mombasa.

headline.main: Kenya Charges Nine Foreigners Over 377-Kg Heroin Haul
headline.print_headline: Kenya Charges Nine Foreigners Over 377-Kg Heroin Haul

snippet: Police fire tear gas at hundreds of protesting youths chanting slogans against President Uhuru Kenyatta. Nathan Frandino reports.
lead_paragraph: Police fire tear gas at hundreds of protesting youths chanting slogans against President Uhuru Kenyatta. Nathan Frandino reports.

headline.main: Protesters rally against government in Kenya
headline.sub: Protesters rally against government in Kenya

snippet: A court ruling means massive migrations of wildlife will not have to contend with a paved road in the Serengeti.
abstract: A court ruling means massive migrations of wildlife will not have to contend with a paved road in the Serengeti.

headline.main: East African Court Blocks Paved Serengeti Highway

snippet: The Kenyan president, Uhuru Kenyatta, urged citizens to help prevent any future attacks, and witnesses described the scene after two explosions at a packed market in Nairobi.
lead_paragraph: The Kenyan president, Uhuru Kenyatta, urged citizens to help prevent any future attacks, and witnesses described the scene after two explosions at a packed market in Nairobi.

headline.main: Kenyans Describe Twin Blasts in Nairobi

snippet: The authorities said the attack on a police station and two hotels in the coastal town of Mpeketoni was carried out by the Somali militant group Shabab.
lead_paragraph: The authorities said the attack on a police station and two hotels in the coastal town of Mpeketoni was carried out by the Somali militant group Shabab.
abstract: At least 48 people are killed in attack by dozens of militants on Kenyan coastal town of Mpeketoni; government blames Somali extremist group the Shabab.

headline.main: Coast Town Is Attacked in Kenya; Dozens Die
headline.print_headline: Coast Town Is Attacked in Kenya; Dozens Die

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris. Jeffrey Gettleman contributed reporting from Antalya, Turkey.
byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY

snippet: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.
lead_paragraph: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.
abstract: Kenya's Pres Uhuru Kenyatta blames domestic foes, not Somali extremist group Shabab, for attack in Lamu that left at least 57 people dead; Shabab claimed responsibility for attack, but Kenyatta says evidence points to local political networks; some analysts question Kenyatta's effort to shift blame as political ploy.

headline.main: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.
byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY
